result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Floyd Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Report to Jail, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.

Must report to jail no later than 4/2/2016.
Subject to good time and work release.

Must provide DNA sample, no surcharge.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

15CF5-AMENDED INFORMATION filed - Count 1 repeater stricken-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Counts 2/3-dismissed.
Waiver of PSI.  

SENTENCE:  
14CF434-16 days PCJ, sub to GT & WR.  $290.60 fine/costs, 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.  Must provide DNA sample, no surcharge.  Must report to jail no later than 4/2/2016.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must report to Probation today.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
